isis.stitle: Side Mount Cooling Package - RE Bus - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - HYDRAULIC OIL COOLER

important.para: Prior to draining any coolant from the system, close two heater shut-off valves. The heater shut-off valves can be accessed through the left-side rear compartment service door.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the rear compartment service door.
Locate the radiator drain valve prior to removal of the hydraulic oil cooler. Place tray under the radiator to collect coolant from radiator. Open drain valve and drain coolant ( Figure 4).
Remove two bolts, washers, and nuts from the hydraulic oil cooler and clipping brackets.
Position hydraulic hoses out of the way.
Place a suitable container under the hydraulic oil cooler to catch the hydraulic oil from the system.
Drain the hydraulic fluid by removing the drain plug from the bottom of the hydraulic oil cooler.

item.para: Tag and mark hoses before removal to ensure proper installation.
Cap and plug all hoses upon removal to stop leakage and prevent contamination.

important.para: If the transmission is equipped with a retarder the hydraulic oil cooler will have one small coolant bypass hose on the right-side and two coolant hoses connected to the left-side. If the transmission has no retarder than only two coolant hoses will be connected to the left-side of the hydraulic oil cooler.

step1.para: Loosen clamps on three coolant hoses, two on the right side of the hydraulic oil cooler and one on the left side of the hydraulic oil cooler. Remove three coolant hoses from the hydraulic oil cooler.
Disconnect two hydraulic hoses from the hydraulic oil cooler.
Disconnect two hydraulic transmission hoses from the hydraulic oil cooler.

warning.para: A jack and strap should be used to remove the hydraulic oil cooler. The hydraulic oil cooler weighs 110 lbs. (50 kg). Failure to comply could result in personal injury.

step1.para: Position a suitable jack under the hydraulic oil cooler and secure the jack with a strap around the hydraulic oil cooler.
Remove two bolts, washers, and nuts from top of the hydraulic oil cooler. Remove the hydraulic oil cooler from the mount bracket.
If replacement is needed, transfer all fittings to the new hydraulic oil cooler.
Position the hydraulic oil cooler on a suitable jack and secure the jack with a strap around the hydraulic oil cooler.
Align the hydraulic oil cooler on the mount bracket and install top two bolts, washers, and nuts ( Figure 20, Items 3, 4, and 5). Torque bolts to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).

caution.para: Some hydraulic hoses and fittings in the hydraulic system are equipped with O-rings to seal the hydraulic hoses. Inspect all O-rings prior to installation and replace as needed.

note.para: Be sure to remove all caps and plugs that were installed during the removal procedures before installing hydraulic hoses.

step1.para: Connect two hydraulic transmission hoses to the hydraulic oil cooler ( Figure 20, Items 4 and 7).
Connect two hydraulic hoses to the hydraulic oil cooler ( Figure 20, Items 4 and 6).

important.para: If the transmission is equipped with a retarder the hydraulic oil cooler will have one small coolant bypass hose on the right-side and two coolant hoses connected to the left-side. If the transmission has no retarder than only two coolant hoses will be connected to the left-side of the hydraulic oil cooler.

step1.para: Install three coolant hoses on the hydraulic oil cooler and secure clamps ( Figure 20, Items 1, 2, and 4).
Install two bolts, washers, and nuts on the hydraulic oil cooler and clipping brackets ( Figure 19). Torque bolts to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).
Install the drain plug in the hydraulic oil cooler ( Figure 19, Items 1 and 5).
Fill the hydraulic system.
Fill cooling system to proper level and leak test the cooling system. Special Tool number 550500INT is recommended to fill and leak test the cooling system.

important.para: After filling the cooling system, open two heater shut-off valves and recheck the coolant level. The heater shut-off valves can be accessed through the left-side rear compartment service door.

step1.para: Close and latch the rear compartment service door.
